channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024070279
item.description:
Report X-2024070279

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: No spill. Hazmat, undeclared (no DOT labels/markings on outer packaging, no Overpack label). Torn fiberboard box. One 76lb SAFT No. 414975 Mod. 409CH2 NiCad Battery Assy. Note: inner packaging (also a fiberboard box) has UNPOP, diamond label, UN number, and Proper Shipping Name. No OP-950A, OP-900, or HAZ SVC code.

item.title: Report X-2024070222
item.description:
Report X-2024070222

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Spill. Hazmat, undeclared (no DOT labels/markings) and overweight (100lb. See 49CFR 173.27(f)(2)(iii) for LQ weight limit and FXG hazmat shipping guide page 8 for fully regulated weight limit). Leaking fiberboard box. 10x1gal Natures Pure 27% Hydrogen peroxide. 0.1 gal loss from failed safety seal below cap of one bottle. Please note that 1.800.633.8253 (found on product) was called and a request was sent to sds@ambipar.com for the SDS. Report will be updated when more information becomes available.

item.title: Report X-2024070245
item.description:
Report X-2024070245

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-27
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was found with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained four plastic jugs separated with a fiberboard divider. One of the plastic jugs cracked on the body causing a release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024070268
item.description:
Report X-2024070268

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-26
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH location. The fiberboard box contained three glass bottles that were packaged in individual plastic sealed bags. One of the bottles broke and spilled it's contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and anew declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024070064
item.description:
Report X-2024070064

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-29
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 28th during the PM sort a package contained 2 glass bottles of UN1267, PETROLEUM CRUDE OIL, 3, III was found with signs of leakage. One of the glass bottles inside was found broken and the entire contents leaked out. The bottles were in a plastic bag filled with vermiculite, however the bag was unable to contain all of the spill. The package as placed into a salvage drum and the shipper contacted for disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024060681
item.description:
Report E-2024060681

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 19, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured by a forklift and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of paint to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental & Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted site. E3 personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. One damaged drum of UN1263 was containerized in one (1) 95-gallon over pack drum, and all spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All waste was left onsite.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained metal cants in plastic bag with vermiculite. The lid on one the cans opened up and spilled it's contents in the box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Description: A fiberboard box was discovered with signs of release during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained twenty six glass bottle packaged with a fiberboard divider and sheets of bubble wrap for dunnage. Four of the glass bottles were broken spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
